canvases.label: Rev. Thomas Haweis (1734-1820), LLB, MD. Rector of Aldwinkle, Northants

metadata.value: Rev. Thomas Haweis (1734-1820), LLB, MD. Rector of Aldwinkle, Northants
metadata.label: Title

metadata.value: 'Published as the Act directs July 1. 1796, by M. Tijou, No.22, Greek Street, Soho [London].'
metadata.label: Imprint

metadata.value: Thomas Haweis became the apprentice to a surgeon-apothecary at an early age. He matriculated from Christ Church, Oxford University but never actually completed a degree there. In 1757 he was ordained a priest and was appointed a chaplain to the Earl of Peterborough. From 1764 until his death Haweis was rector of Aldwincle in Northamptonshire. In 1768 he became chaplain to Selina Hastings, countess of Huntingdon (1707-1791). In 1772 he received the degree of Batchelor of Law at Cambridge University. Haweis was very interested in foreign missions, particularly those to Africa and the South Seas, and he was one of the first to promote through his sermons, the London Missionary Society in 1794. He published many works and took a great interest in the improvement of conditions for the poor.
